intro: Lithospermum sericeum, commonly known as silverleaf lithospermum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems covered in silvery, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Lithospermum sericeum is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
